intro: Diplusodon lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are often borne on short pedicels. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Diplusodon lanceolatus is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
